intro: Clematoclethra henryi, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen honeysuckle, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, red berries in the fall. It thrives in partial shade and moist, well-drained soil, making it a suitable ornamental plant for gardens. Its unique appearance and seasonal color changes make it a valuable addition to botanical collections.
